page.title: 03PADSTOW LIFEBOAT
page.content: 47' Tyne Class boat named{R.N.L.B. {JAMES BURROUGH}by Miss M.Allen, the donor, March 1985.Carries a crew of{7} and has a cruising range of{300 miles} at{18 knots.}Housed in a boat house with a slipway at{TREVOSE HEAD}where low tide and silt cause no problems. Recovered up the slip by a powerful electric winch.Launched on average{25} times per year, she has a survivor capacity of approximately{80}persons. The boat has been launched in a gale gusting to{120 knots.}Some{200}people have been saved by the Padstow boats since the present Coxswain, Trevor England, has been on the crew.Like all the rest of the crew Mr. England is a part-time lifeboatman- he is also a fisherman.Only the mechanic is employed full-time.
